div1.p: Reed comments on family members. Lawrence Reed is in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, February 2, 1899

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
Feb. 2. '99

div1.p:
Here I am
still, pegging away for dear
life - never worked so
hard in all my life, but
otherwise am very well -
was so glad to even get
a postal from you, but
then, you were never a
very good letter writer!
smart joke that! I would
so like to run down for
even a day, but the thing
simply “can't be did”!

Am glad to hear that
Doug. is better, although
I dare say he prefers
life in another world
to his good wife in
this! That's not a joke!
Have you recovered from
your mud in Farmville
yet? That was very
amusing! Bless that
dear little girl of Kit's;
how I should like to
see her! Ask her how
old she is, & what she would
like me to send her to make
her little life happier? Tell
her that I have met her
father & was very much
pleased with him!

Well, I must stop this
& get to work - Brace
up, old lady, & write
me a letter-from
div1.closer:
Your Kittenish brother, Walter Love to all the dear chil-
dren-
Lawrence is in Cuba--
